question: The surface of a heated metal object measures 120°C. It is dropped into a bucket filled with water measuring 10°C. Which of the following is most likely to occur?
candidate_answers: (A) Both the water and metal will adjust to the same temperature below 10°C. (B) The water and metal will adjust to different temperatures above 120°C. (C) The water will remain the same temperature, but the metal will cool to 10°C. (D) The water and metal will adjust to the same temperature between 10°C and 120°C.
answer: The water will remain the same temperature, but the metal will cool to 10°C.
label: C
